channel.title: RSCA/Standalone MoparClassic Client Resolutions
channel.description:
When I have the resolution's width 1630 or greater and I rotate the camera just right (or hold it there are black flashes), some regions aren't being rendered. http://imageshack.us/a/img11/729/wtfct.png
Also, it seems like it happens half-way between the camera angles when it's set to auto.
There is also another graphical glitch (that doesn't have anything to do with camera rotation with a height of 1316 or more.
Any idea what is going on?

item.title: RSCA/Standalone MoparClassic Client Resolutions
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

When messing with the camera’s textures one day, i noticed that when rotating the camera that the tree leaves texture were flashing black. maybe the two are related

Read full topic

item.title: RSCA/Standalone MoparClassic Client Resolutions
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:2, topic:468832”]you say it flashes, does that mean that the region is only being rendered sometimes?[/quote]There are certain angles that it doesn’t render at.
[hr]I just noticed that it only happens when fog of war is disabled.

It seems 41000 is a bit too high for the zoom settings… So, searched the forums for a better solution I posted ages ago. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,416532.msg3187147.html#msg3187147

Read full topic
